name: group.get()
content:
Gets the sprite at index i of the group.

Every sprite that you add to a group is given an index number based on the order that it was inserted, starting with index number zero. Sprites in a group are usually acted upon identically using the Group functions provided, but some animations or games require different actions for different sprites in a group. Using a loop and `group.get(i)` allows you to act upon each sprite individually from a group.

examples.name: Go for the Gold
examples.description: Find up to 3 gold coins hidden randomly. You have 8 guesses.

palette_params.name: i
palette_params.description: The index position of a sprite from the group.

return_value: The sprite at index position i.
short_description: Gets the sprite at index i of the group.
tips:
- Groups of sprites all have the same functions and you use the dot notation (combining the name of the group, followed by a dot, with the function name) to call the function for that group of sprites.
- Any changes to the properties of a sprite will not be seen until after `drawSprites()` is called.
